title: Table Lamp, "Anywhere", ca. 1951
medium: Enameled sheet steel, aluminum, molded Bakelite, rubber cord
provenance: 2014, acquired by Cooper Hewitt from George Kravis II. Acquired by George Kravis II before 2011.
creditline: Gift of George R. Kravis II
description: Orange, pivoting domed shade mounted on orange bulb housing with continous, curved tubular metal base.
justification: With its smoothly curved silhouette and minimal use of color, the Anywhere lamp is a landmark example of modernism applied to lighting design. It is also a product of Greta von Nessen’s resilience as a designer and a businesswoman. After the death of her husband, designer Walter von Nessen, Greta reopened their design firm, Nessen Studios. While she resumed the production of Walter’s most successful modern lighting designs, she began selling some of her own lighting innovations as well. Walter von Nessen’s most iconic contribution to design is his series of angular swing arm lamps that allow the user to swivel the light source from one side of the lamp to the other. Greta’s Anywhere Lamp is similarly functional. It can be placed on a table, mounted on a wall or suspended from the ceiling with a simple revolution of the enameled domed shade on its curved tubular framework. With the Anywhere lamp, Greta expanded upon her husband’s design fundamentals, elevating lighting to a new level of streamlined form and utility. The strikingly modern lamp preserves the legacy of an exceptionally strong mid-twentieth century &nbsp;designer.

tombstone.epitaph: Table Lamp, "Anywhere", ca. 1951. Enameled sheet steel, aluminum, molded Bakelite, rubber cord. Gift of George R. Kravis II. 2014-25-3.
